original_title: Sri Lanka Treasuries yields steady at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bills yields were largely unchanged at Wednesday’s auction with 155.1 billion rupees out of 160 billion rupees offered bills being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office offered 40 billion rupees of 3-month bills and sold 64.9 billion at 14.45 percent, down 06 basis points.
70 billion rupees of 6-moth bills were offered and 88.6 billion rupees were sold at 14.16 percent, unchanged from a week earlier.
50 billion rupees of 12-month bills were offered and only 1.5 billion rupees were sold at 12.93 percent, unchanged from last week.
Phase II subscriptions were offered at the weighted average yield for the 12-month bills. (Colombo/Jan03/2023)
